meanings.definition: To receive a degree or diploma from a school or university.
meanings.sent1: She graduated from college with honors.
meanings.sent2: He will graduate next year with a bachelor's degree.
meanings.sent3: The penguin graduated from fish school with a diploma in swimming.
meanings.sent4: Her skills have graduated to a whole new level.
meanings.sent5: After years of hard work, she finally graduated and achieved her dream.

meanings.definition: To mark or divide into degrees or other proportionate divisions.
meanings.sent1: The thermometer graduated the temperature in small increments.
meanings.sent2: The ruler is used to graduate the length of the paper.
meanings.sent3: The chef graduated the spices from mild to spicy in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The colors on the painting graduated from light to dark seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The music volume gradually graduated to a crescendo.

meanings.definition: To change by degrees or stages.
meanings.sent1: The sky gradually graduated from blue to pink during sunset.
meanings.sent2: The student's understanding of the topic graduated over time.
meanings.sent3: The plant graduated in height as it reached for the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His emotions graduated from confusion to clarity after talking to his friend.
meanings.sent5: The cityscape graduated from old buildings to modern skyscrapers.
